verses.kjv: Him that is weak in the faith receive ye, but not to doubtful disputations.
verses.ct: Welcome anyone whose faith is still developing, but don't drag them into arguments over debatable issues.

verses.kjv: For one believeth that he may eat all things: another, who is weak, eateth herbs.
verses.ct: One person has the confidence to eat anything, while someone with weaker faith eats only vegetables.

verses.kjv: Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not; and let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth: for God hath received him.
verses.ct: The person who eats everything should not look down on the one who doesn't, and the one who doesn't eat everything should not condemn the one who does — because God has accepted that person.

verses.kjv: Who art thou that judgest another man’s servant? to his own master he standeth or falleth. Yea, he shall be holden up: for God is able to make him stand.
verses.ct: Who are you to pass judgment on someone else's servant? It's before their own master that they stand or fall. And they will stand, because God has the power to keep them on their feet.

verses.kjv: One man esteemeth one day above another: another esteemeth every day alike. Let every man be fully persuaded in his own mind.
verses.ct: Some people consider one day more sacred than another, while others treat every day the same. Each person should be fully convinced in their own mind.

verses.kjv: He that regardeth the day, regardeth it unto the Lord; and he that regardeth not the day, to the Lord he doth not regard it. He that eateth, eateth to the Lord, for he giveth God thanks; and he that eateth not, to the Lord he eateth not, and giveth God thanks.
verses.ct: The person who honors a special day does so for the Lord. The person who eats anything does so for the Lord, since they give thanks to God. And the person who refrains from eating also does so for the Lord, and they too give thanks to God.

verses.kjv: For none of us liveth to himself, and no man dieth to himself.
verses.ct: None of us lives for ourselves alone, and none of us dies for ourselves alone.

verses.kjv: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord’s.
verses.ct: If we live, we live for the Lord, and if we die, we die for the Lord. So whether we live or die, we belong to the Lord.

verses.kjv: For to this end Christ both died, and rose, and revived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and living.
verses.ct: This is exactly why Christ died and came back to life — so that he would be Lord over both the dead and the living.

verses.kjv: But why dost thou judge thy brother? or why dost thou set at nought thy brother? for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.
verses.ct: So why do you condemn your brother or sister? And why do you look down on them? All of us will stand before the judgment seat of Christ.

verses.kjv: For it is written, As I live, saith the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.
verses.ct: For Scripture says, 'As surely as I live, says the Lord, every knee will bow before me, and every tongue will acknowledge God.'

verses.kjv: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.
verses.ct: So then, each one of us will give an account of ourselves to God.

verses.kjv: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brother’s way.
verses.ct: Therefore, let's stop passing judgment on each other. Instead, make up your mind not to place an obstacle or a trap in your brother or sister's path.

verses.kjv: I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, that there is nothing unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean, to him it is unclean.
verses.ct: I know and am fully convinced through the Lord Jesus that nothing is impure in itself. But if someone considers something to be impure, then for that person it is impure.

verses.kjv: But if thy brother be grieved with thy meat, now walkest thou not charitably. Destroy not him with thy meat, for whom Christ died.
verses.ct: If what you eat causes your brother or sister distress, you are no longer acting in love. Don't let your food choices destroy someone for whom Christ died.

verses.kjv: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:
verses.ct: Don't allow something you consider good to be spoken of as evil.

verses.kjv: For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost.
verses.ct: Because the kingdom of God is not about food and drink — it's about righteousness, peace, and joy in the Holy Spirit.

verses.kjv: For he that in these things serveth Christ is acceptable to God, and approved of men.
verses.ct: Anyone who serves Christ in this way is pleasing to God and respected by people.

verses.kjv: Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.
verses.ct: So let's pursue the things that promote peace and that build each other up.

verses.kjv: For meat destroy not the work of God. All things indeed are pure; but it is evil for that man who eateth with offence.
verses.ct: Don't tear down God's work over food. Everything is indeed pure, but it becomes wrong for a person who eats it while causing someone else to stumble.

verses.kjv: It is good neither to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor any thing whereby thy brother stumbleth, or is offended, or is made weak.
verses.ct: The right thing to do is to avoid eating meat, drinking wine, or doing anything else that causes your brother or sister to stumble, be offended, or become weakened in their faith.

verses.kjv: Hast thou faith? have it to thyself before God. Happy is he that condemneth not himself in that thing which he alloweth.
verses.ct: Whatever conviction you have about these things, keep it between yourself and God. Blessed is the person who doesn't feel guilty about what they've decided is acceptable.

verses.kjv: And he that doubteth is damned if he eat, because he eateth not of faith: for whatsoever is not of faith is sin.
verses.ct: But the person who has doubts is condemned if they eat, because their eating doesn't come from faith. And everything that does not come from faith is sin.
